Vanilla and Hazelnut Macarons Recipe

Ingredients:

  • For the Macaron Shells:
    • 1 cup powdered sugar
    • 1 cup almond flour
    • 1/2 cup granulated sugar
    • 3 large egg whites
    • A pinch of salt
    • 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
    • A few drops of food coloring (optional)
  • For the Vanilla Buttercream Filling:
    • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
    • 1 cup powdered sugar
    • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
    • 1 tablespoon milk or heavy cream
    • 1/4 cup finely chopped hazelnuts (roasted)

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the Macaron Shells: Sift together the powdered sugar and almond flour into a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the granulated sugar to the egg whites while continuing to whisk, until the mixture is glossy and thick. Gently fold in the sifted almond flour mixture into the egg whites, along with the vanilla extract. If desired, add a few drops of food coloring. Pipe the mixture onto a baking sheet and let it sit to form a skin, then bake for 15-18 minutes.
  2. Make the Vanilla Buttercream Filling: In a bowl, beat the softened butter until fluffy. Gradually add powdered sugar and mix until smooth. Add vanilla extract and milk (or cream), then fold in chopped hazelnuts.
  3. Assemble the Macarons: Once the macaron shells are cooled, pair them up by size. Pipe a small amount of vanilla buttercream onto the flat side of one macaron shell, then sandwich it with another shell. Press gently.
  4. Chill and Serve: Let the assembled macarons chill in the fridge for 24 hours before serving.
